column4: I'm trying to join a samba domain with my XP client but xp client says "domain can't be join". I see UDP packets from client to  pdc and other way. my pdc is ready and listen to connection with an ldap backend. I use smbldap-tools and they are configure such as nsswitch.conf. Someone can help me for this?
are you have configure your samba, ldap, correctly ?
I think unless I miss something
i have ever configure it, and works greats..but i forgot for documenting it
are you sure name resolving was not your problem ?
I don't think, samba is wins server too and name resolve order = lmhosts host wins bcast.
I'll check that
yeah.. i'm not my office server..sory can't help you so much
I add a wins server in XP client, i have the same message but a log.clientName  appear, i'll check it
i'm waiting for that
All right, I'm in my domain! It was a name resolution error I think because I just change wins options in windows
greats works...congratulations
Thank you... but it was just the first part. Now I have to configure a remote bdc for my pdc. I'm try to do that since one week but I can't join the domain with a client in bdc's subnet
i no have experience to setup with bdc..but i think from help.ubuntu.com there are greats howto
I followed different howto with no results, so I try a second time.
hello
how about your dual boot install ?
my dual boot install? I'm currently working on samba
hufft..sorry..
setup bdc
my bdc is up just don't want to resolve names and contact pdc
